title: Shahzada Dawood, Wealthy Executive, Died With Son, Suleman, on Submersible
description: Mr. Dawood, a British Pakistani businessman, was the vice chairman of Engro Corporation, a conglomerate owned by one of the richest families in Pakistan.

title: Missiles Strike Russian-Held Bridge Far Behind Ukraine Front Line
description: The attack damaged a bridge in the Russian-occupied Crimean Peninsula that Moscow uses to resupply its forces in Ukraine.

title: Mexico’s Supreme Court Rejects AMLO-Backed Election Changes
description: The ruling from the country’s top court came as President Andrés Manuel López Obrador ramps up his attacks on the judicial system.

title: Hamish Harding, an Explorer Who Knew No Bounds Until He Found One, Dies at 58
description: An aviation tycoon who forever pushed the limits, he went to the depths of the ocean and the blackness of space before his fateful dive to the Titanic.

title: Modi and Biden Meet to Strengthen India-U.S. Relations
description: In a rare unscripted response during a news conference, the Indian leader ducked a question about his government’s treatment of minorities, saying there was “no question of discrimination.”

title: Turkey Raises Interest Rates as Erdogan Aims to Tame Inflation
description: In his choices of top officials, and with a leap in interest rates, Mr. Erdogan aims to tame inflation and defuse a looming economic crisis.

title: Protecting Marine Life Also Helps People Nearby, Study Says
description: A study of marine-protected areas off the Central American coast found that people living close to these areas had better food security and greater household wealth.

title: Israeli-Palestinian Violence Is Spiraling in the Occupied West Bank
description: The Palestinian Authority is absent from the hotbeds of militancy while Israeli forces have failed to prevent violent reprisal attacks by Jewish extremists.

title: Search Enters ‘Critical Day’ as More Vessels Arrive
description: International teams deployed remote-controlled, underwater vehicles as part of the increasingly urgent search for the Titan submersible that disappeared in the North Atlantic.

title: Bridge to Russian-Occupied Crimea Is Damaged
description: A Russian-backed official blamed Ukraine for a strike on a bridge to the peninsula, a region vital to Moscow’s war effort.

title: Paris Fire and Explosion Leave 1 Missing and 6 Critically Hurt
description: The origin of the explosion, which gutted a building in the Fifth Arrondissement and injured about 50 people, is still unclear.

title: The Politics of Class
description: We’re covering the class inversion in American politics, severe weather in Texas and the Indian prime minister’s visit to the U.S.

title: Global Climate Economy Conference Begins in Paris
description: Hundreds of representatives from about 80 countries are gathering in Paris to talk about rebuilding a monetary system many say is ill-suited to a changing planet.

title: Belarus Is Fast Becoming a ‘Vassal State’ of Russia
description: Allowing Moscow to place tactical nuclear weapons on its soil is just the latest sign of its loss of sovereignty to the Kremlin, military experts and pro-democracy activists say.

title: Korean Youth Hostel Once a Site of Interrogation and Torture
description: A building where South Korean dissidents were interrogated and tortured by a powerful government agency is now home to a popular youth hostel.

title: ‘The Country Is His Family’: Why Modi and Other Indian Leaders Stay Single
description: India’s politicians need a lot of time to attend to 1.4 billion people. And with corruption widespread, those without families are often seen as less likely to steal.

title: American Reporter Jailed in Russia Is Scheduled to Appear in Court
description: Evan Gershkovich, an American journalist who has been based in Russia for years, was arrested in March and charged with spying, which he denies.

title: What to Know About Modi’s Visit and U.S.-India Relations
description: The visit has big implications for U.S.-India relations as President Biden seeks to shore up an alliance against Russia’s aggression and China’s economic influence.

title: Restaurant Explosion Kills Dozens in China
description: The deadly blast, in the northwestern city of Yinchuan, was blamed on a gas leak, and it is likely to prompt closer scrutiny of restaurants that feature gas grills.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The final hours of oxygen aboard a missing submersible.

title: China’s Cloud Computing Firms Raise Concern for U.S.
description: The Biden administration is exploring whether it can mount a campaign against Chinese tech giants like Alibaba and Huawei, potentially fueling tensions with Beijing.
